result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T. Griffith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan T. Griffith

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:30 AM.
Defendant Jordan T. Griffith in court, in custody with Attorney William A. Schembera.  Attorney Loralee Clark in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Substantial Battery; Repeater. Prior acknowledged.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights
Defendant makes a statement to the Court. 
Defendant is sentenced to 2 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 1.5 Years of Extended Supervision.  Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. No contact with B.S.  Court Costs/surcharges. DNA Sample/Surcharge.
Defendant is not granted any sentence credit. Court finds the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.
Status conference on July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

(Case called at 2:27 PM) Defendant Jordan T. Griffith in court, in custody.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Jordan T. Griffith.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense indicates that the Defendant wants wait until after a revocation hearing in another case- requests to reschedule to June/July. 
Status Conference: 07/15/2022 at 8:30 AM.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(11:28 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jordan T. Griffith in court, in custody. Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Jordan T. Griffith.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Schembera requests to schedule a new date for after May 9, 2022. State advises parties are working on a global resolution and requests a date at end of May.
Status Conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 2:30 pm.

(1:28 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jordan T. Griffith in court, in custody. Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Jordan T. Griffith.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Schembera to schedule and Arraignment with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:14 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Jordan Griffith appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing: 03/29/2022 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with B.S. (victim), co-defendant (H.W.), Regency Inn & Suites.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
